title: Ticket #5131: sort hosts/slots numerically in condor_status
description:
The default output of condor_status apparently sorts by OPSYS, ARCH, MACHINE, NAME. If you have >= 10 slots, you end up with a funny-looking sort:

The very-low-hanging fruit I'm eyeing up here is just to change the sorting for the default output of condor_status (not messing with aggregates or custom sorting), by changing the comparison for the MACHINE and NAME fields from the current strcmp(3) to strverscmp(3), where available. (It's a gnu extension, so it has to be #ifdef'd.) The result is the natural-looking sort of the slots (1,2,...,9,10,11,...).

I discussed this with Zach, who recommended just making it the new default rather than making an option for it.

Tim T gave the go-ahead to check the small change into master.
remarks:
2015-Jul-06 15:45:36 by edquist:
So, TJ wanted to hold off on making this the default until we can do it everywhere (that is, on non-linux too), and asked that I make an option for it, and suggested the option name -natural with a min prefix of -nat ...

TJ was talking about implementing strverscmp in condor so that the natural sort output can be used in Windows, and, at that point maybe for other tool outputs.

Anyway, there's now an option for it, -natural, and the default is false.

2015-Aug-26 09:18:38 by tim:
We will make this work over all platforms for 8.4.0, default off. For 8.5.0, the default changes to on.

2015-Aug-27 16:42:05 by edquist:
With a go-ahead from TJ and TimT, I checked in a new natural_cmp() function in [45738] under condor_utils, in a new V8_3_8-gt5131-natural_cmp branch. It's a drop in replacement for strcmp(3), written from scratch based on the specifications laid out in the strverscmp(3) man page. My tests show identical function results for various inputs, and nearly identical performance.

For condor_status, I took out the GLIBC ifdefs, since this doesn't use any gnu extensions, but I left the option default off.

TimT, you can merge this into whatever branches become relevant (8_3_8, 8_4, 8_5, master, ...).

2015-Aug-31 15:56:38 by edquist:
Merged branch V8_3_8-gt5131-natural_cmp into V8_4-branch per TJ. (Haven't merged into master yet -- but you should be able to whenever.)

The option in condor_status is still off by default.

2015-Aug-31 16:23:52 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: This looks very good

2015-Sep-25 11:42:10 by edquist:
I chatted with TJ about turning the -natural option on by default in 8.5.x; he suggested for now just switching the default to be on and supporting a -nat[ural]:off in case anybody really wants to disable it and get the old behavior.

I checked this into master in [45891].

Attaching sample output with -nat on by default.
